text: Air Chief Marshal Sir David George Parry-Evans, (19 July 1935 - 25 August 2020) was a senior Royal Air Force commander. ==RAF career== Educated at Berkhamsted School, Parry-Evans joined the Royal Air Force in 1956.Debrett's People of Today 1994 He became Officer Commanding No. 214 Squadron in 1974 and Station Commander at RAF Marham in 1975. He was appointed Director of Defence Policy at the Ministry of Defence in 1979, Commandant of the RAF Staff College, Bracknell, in 1981 and then Air Officer Commanding No. 1 Group in 1982 before becoming Air Officer Commanding No. 38 Group in 1984. He went on to be Commander-in-Chief RAF Germany and Second Tactical Air Force in 1985, Deputy Chief of the Defence Staff (Programmes and Personnel) in 1987 and Air Member for Personnel in 1989 before retiring in 1991. In retirement he became President of the Shackleton Association.Shackleton Association , thegrowler.org.uk; accessed 16 March 2019. ==Family== In 1960, he married Ann Reynolds; they had two sons. Parry-Evans died on 25 August 2020, at the age of 85, following a short illness. ==References== |- |- |- Category:1935 births Category:2020 deaths Category:People educated at Berkhamsted School Category:Knights Grand Cross of the Order of the Bath Category:Commanders of the Order of the British Empire Category:Royal Air Force air marshals
